Room.Name: The Chat Room
Room.Description: You are lounging in a quiet cosy parlour, warmed by a gentle magical fire which twinkles happily in a warm fireplace. This is one of the many rooms where the heroes and gods come to socialize. It is by far one of the most comfortable!

Exit.Description: Asgard lies to the south.

Room.Name: Moses' Hangout
Room.Description: Moses' Hangout is a warm and inviting room designed for rest and rejuvenation. The fireplace is the centerpiece, with a burning bush giving off a soft, warm glow. Two stone tablets and a bible rest on a small ledge near the fireplace, serving as a reminder of the divine inspiration that this room is named after. A plush couch and comfortable armchairs are arranged in front of the fireplace, inviting visitors to sink into their soft cushions and enjoy the flickering fire. There is a television and stereo system in the room, as well as a hot tub in the corner, offering the ultimate in relaxation. A small bell sits on a nearby table, allowing guests to summon the butler with ease. This room truly provides a sanctuary for the soul.

Exit.Description: Asgard lies to the north.

Room.Name: The Center of the Universe
Room.Description: The center of the universe is a place beyond description, where the laws of physics and reality as we know it no longer apply. The space is filled with an otherworldly radiance, a brilliant light in every color imaginable, pulsing with an energy that defies comprehension. Here, time seems to stand still, and the boundaries of space are blurred beyond recognition. The air is thick with an intangible essence, charged with the power of creation and boundless possibility. Exits to all 42 dimensions open before you, leading to every corner of the multiverse and beyond. The energy of this place is both calming and invigorating, filled with a sense of peace and infinite potential. Here, one feels as if they have reached the very heart of existence, a place where all things are possible and anything can be created with a single thought.

Exit.Description: Asgard lies to the east.

Room.Name: Valhalla
Room.Description: This is the huge Hall of Valhalla, where the Gods rule supreme. The cavernous building stretches infinitely in all directions. Valhalla continues to the east, and the gods make their homes north and south of the halls. The golden gates are to the west. You know not what lies upward...

Exit.Description: Alander's workroom is to the north.
Valhalla continues east.
A sea cave is south of here.
The entrance to Valhalla is to the west.
If you want to know what is up there, you shall have to go look...

Room.Name: Priscilla's Pleasure Palace
Room.Description: As you look around you, you see the largest collection of erotic toys in the world!!! On a table in the middle of the room lies a book titled : "All You Ever Wanted to Know About Sex..But Were Afraid to Ask" There are things here that you never even imagined in your wildest dreams!

Exit.Description: Valhalla is to the north.

Room.Name: The Eye of the Hurricane
Room.Description: The shrieking winds of a monstrous storm surround you, spinning you around in an endless web of fury. But then, in the middle of turmoil, you find a strange calm. You find yourself hovering in the calm eye of a hurricane. All around you you can see the desruction caused by the powerful storm. White hot flashes of lightning flicker from the depths of the hurricane. But everything is strangely peaceful in here, with the sun shining in from above and a flock of birds winging across the sky. You stretch out and relax, this storm is going to be here a while.

Room.Name: The Chamber of Holiness
Room.Description: In each of the cardinal directions a column of marble inlaid with gold supports the ceiling All around you the light bounces from one object to another giving the chamber a golden hue and preventing darkness from ever entering the chamber. The small window carved into the eastern wall gives you a remarkable view of the rest of Valhalla.

ExtraDescription.Description: Looking out the window you can see the city of Vahalla in it's entirety.

Room.Name: The Satin Memorial Reading Room
Room.Description: Half read books lie everywhere: Yeats, Tennyson, Chandler, Barrie; a battered paperback de Laclos; a dusty leather-bound Donne. A damp novel perches precariously on the edge of a large bathtub. As your eyes travel beyond the steam rising to the air toward the rose-brambled balcony railing, you notice a well-creased printout of a poem sitting on a the velvet cushions of a rosewood chair that has been set so as to see the stark black mountains from one angle, or the wine-dark sea from another.

Exit.Description: Valhalla is to the south.

ExtraDescription.Description: Climbing white roses have swarmed over the original marble to obscure it almost completely. The air is sweet not with roses, though, but with Satin's sandalwood perfume.
It looks comfortable, and the cushions are ivory velvet.

ExtraDescription.Keyword: stark black mountains wine wine-dark dark sea
ExtraDescription.Description: The ocean is constantly smashing up against the cliffs and rending huge slabs from it. The beach is scarcely a beach at all, more a collection of rough flakes varying in size from a small car to a small fist. As the water comes up over the rocks and ebbs back down, it filters through the spaces and makes an unnerving rattling sound.

ExtraDescription.Keyword: print out print-out creased well poem
ExtraDescription.Description: This page has been read over so many times that you can barely discern the words, and in fact with much poring only the following becomes clear: 'I know that I am studly - Heck, I'm sexy, cute and cuddly And I know that I'm extremely modest too.'

The page it is flipped open to reads: A sudden blow: the great wings beating still Above the staggering girl, her thighs carressed By the dark webs, her nape caught in his bill, he holds her helpless breast upon his breast. How can those terrified vague fingers push The feathered glory from her loosening thighs? And how can body, laid in that white rush, But feel that strange heart beating where it lies? A shudder in the loins engenders there The broken wall, the burning roof and tower And Agammemnon dead. Being so caught up, So mastered by this brute blood of the air, Did she put on his knowledge with his power Before his indifferent beak could let her drop?

She has just started the Lady in the Lake: Gillerain Regal, the Champagne of Perfumes. It was definitely the stuff to get. One drop of that in the hollow of your throat and the matched pink pearls started falling off you like summer rain.

A copy of Peter Pan is opened near the end: What sort of form was Hook showing? Misguided man though he was, we may be glad, without sympathising with him, that in the end he stayed true to the traditions of his race. The other boys were flying about him now, flouting, scornful; and as he staggered about the deck striking at them impotently, his mind was no longer with them; it was slouching in the playing fields of long ago, or being sent up for good, or watching the wall-game from a famous wall. And his shoes were right, and his waistcoat was right, and his tie was right, and his socks were right. James Hook, thou not wholly unheroic figure, farewell.

. "My mariners Souls that have toiled, and wrought, and thought with me - The ever with a frolic welcome took The thunder and the sunshine, and opposed Free hearts, free foreheads - you and I are old; Old age hath yet his honour and the toil Death closes all; but something ere the end, Some work of noble note, may yet be done, Not unbecoming of men that strove with the gods. The lights begin to twinkle from the rocks; The long day wanes; the slow moon climbs; the deep Moans round with many voices."

. 'One is very soon bored of everything, my angel; it is a law of nature. It is not my fault. If, that is to say, that I am bored with an adventure that has claimed my attentions for four mortal months, it is not my fault. If, that is to say, my love is equal to your virtue - and that is certainly saying a great deal - it is not surprising that one should come to the end at the same time as the other. It is not my fault. A woman that I love madly now insists that I give you up for her. It is not my fault. I quite realize that this is the perfect opportunity to accuse me of perjury: but if, where nature has gifted men with no more than constancy, she has given women obstinacy, it is not my fault. Believe this, you should take another lover, even as I take another mistress. This is good, very good advice: if you find it bad, it is not my fault. Good-bye, my angel. I took you with pleasure, I leave you without regret. I shall come back perhaps. Such is life. It is not my fault.

. `Cruel and sudden, hast thou since Purpled thy nail in blood of innocence? Wherein could this flea guilty be, Except in the drop it sucked from thee? Yet thou trimph'st and say'st that thou Find'st not thyself, nor me the weaker now; 'Tis true, then learn how false fears be: Just so much honour when thou yield'st to me Will waste as this flea's death took life from thee.'

Room.Name: A Sea Cave
Room.Description: You are in a small cave in a cliff next to a deep green sea. Fine gold and pink sand blanket the floor. Shells are scattered and strewn about. A blow hole in the roof of the cave allows beams of light to stream in and illuminate the cave. The wind blows outside the entrance, but you are protected from the weather in your cozy cave. The foamy surf never seems to quite reach your feet. Several boulders here have been worn by time into a shape similar to a comfortable chair.

Exit.Description: Valhalla lies to the north.

Room.Name: The Archmage's Workroom
Room.Description: This well-lit room is absolutely filled with clutter -- enchanting gear, reagents, spell components, ancient tomes, scrolls, braziers, exotic incense and countless other tools of the magical trade, all jumbled together with seemingly no attention paid to organization. You have no doubts that Alander can find whatever he needs without delay, however. A heavy oak door stands barred to the south, to discourage idle visitors, and Alander's quarters are east.

Exit.Description: Valhalla is to the south.

ExtraDescription.Description: It's all worth a fortune, but you'd better not touch it. Alander keeps inventory and holds grudges.
You notice Jimmy Hoffa's ring.

Room.Name: Office
Room.Description: The first thing you notice about this office is the floor; it is a black & white checkerboard pattern, with 8 squares to a side. The south wall is a HUGE picture window that produces a magnificent view of the land. In front of the window is a large desk. Completely covering the east wall is a bookshelf, that is crammed full. In the northwest corner, you notice a statue.

Exit.Description: Valhalla is to the north

ExtraDescription.Description: This desk is much larger than anyone could possibly need. At one end you notice a large, disorderly mass of papers; it must be all his immortal paperwork. At the other end is a magnificent wooden inlaid board with handcrafted ebony and hardwood pieces.

You recognize this as a statue of Robert James Fischer, one of the most creative, if not eccentric, players of all time. The inscription on the base reads, "I like the moment when I crush a man's ego."

This is the most amazing collection of chess books you have ever seen. Everything from Damiano's manuscripts, to a complete collection of the Encyclopedia of Chess Openings, to the latest Imformants are all here.

Room.Name: Arena of Judgement
Room.Description: The scene lain before you is one that gives you the feeling of being placed under a higher authority. The jury is out. A statue of Pontius Pilate is in the aft of the Arena. Staring balefully, the statue faces a distant hillside where many aged crosses still stand. The Arena is set in a wide pit-like field of trampled bloodstained grass, and is guarded by high walls of veinous marble. A bloodstone seat awaits the true paragon of Romanity.

Exit.Description: Valhalla is to the south.

ExtraDescription.Description: A statue of Pontius Pilate is here. On it's face is the expression of some age old contemplation. Standing at the statues bronzy feet is a Blood red shield that glimmers like a pool of blood.

Room.Name: The Realm of the Dead
Room.Description: You are standing on an immense, grey stone floor that stretches as far as you can see in all directions. Rough winds plunging from the dark, starless sky tear savagely at your fragile body.

Exit.Description: The hard floor seems to go on forever.
The hard floor seems to go on forever.
The hard floor seems to go on forever.
The hard floor seems to go on forever.

ExtraDescription.Description: Cold winds plunge ceaselessly at you from the dark, cloudless sky.
The stone floor is the same shade of grey as the sky and is completely plain and unscratched. It is probably too hard for anything to leave as much as a scratch on it.

Room.Name: Asgard
Room.Description: You stand on a huge expanse of glass. Below you are clouds and the pains of mortality. As you stand in Asgard, home of the bravest of the brave, you are frozen in awe of the power held within these walls. A huge mansion lies to the east beyond a set of magnificent golden doors.

Exit.Description: The chat room is to the north.
The golden doors of Valhalla are to the east
Moses' hangout is to the south.
The center of the universe is to the west.
The Rainbow Bridge is below you. You can barely see it through the clouds.

Room.Name: The Room of Lost Souls
Room.Description: This is the room full of souls that never made it to Asgard. They are trapped here eternally, left to wander about in misery. They were infidels and cowards. Their cries of misery send a shiver down your spine.

Room.Name: Head of the Rainbow Bridge
Room.Description: Standing on the mortal end of the Rainbow Bridge, the bridge arches up before you and seems to disappear into the clouds. You wonder if it is wise to venture upward into the realm of the gods. But it seems so calm and peaceful here that it would be a shame to leave...

Exit.Description: The Rainbow Bridge stretches ahead before you.
The pond of Midgaard is below you.

Room.Name: The Entrance of Valhalla
Room.Description: The huge ornate entrance of Valhalla is before you. It seems as though atleast eight-hundred soldiers could walk abreast of one another through these doors. You stare in awe at the sparkling mansion before you. You wonder what secrets are held behind these doors and long to hear the stories of bravery and glory that you know are kept within the walls of Valhalla.

Exit.Description: Valhalla lies to the east.
Asgard lies to the west.

Room.Name: Valhalla
Room.Description: You are standing in the halls of Valhalla. Pictures of Odin, Thor, Tyr, Loki, Freyr, Feyja, and Balder line the walls. The cavernous hall extends to the east and west. Rooms belonging to the gods lie to the north and south. There appears to be an exit above you, but you do not know what is up there...

Exit.Description: The Satin Memorial Reading Room is north of here.
Valhalla continues east.
Bigfoots' room is south of here.
Valhalla continues west.
If you want to know what is up there you shall have to go and look...

Room.Name: Valhalla
Room.Description: You are standing in the halls of Valhalla. Tapestries of the gods line the walls. A statue of Odin is here. The halls continue to the east and west, and there are doors to the north and south of you. There is some sort of exit above you, but you do not know where it leads...

Exit.Description: Pontius' room is north of here.
Valhalla continues east.
Priscilla's Pleasure Palace is south of here.
Valhalla continues west.
If you want to know what is up there you shall have to go up and see...

ExtraDescription.Description: The statue of Odin has been exquisitely crafted. It is of white marble with black and gold veins. It looks to be of magical origin.

Room.Name: Valhalla
Room.Description: You have reached the end of the halls of Valhalla. There are heavy doors on 3 walls. They lead into the rooms of the gods. The hall goes back to the west, and there is some sort of an exit above you. Torches sputter softly and the scent of incense is strong here.

Exit.Description: Melancholys' room is north of here.
Kates' room is east of here.
The Temple of Stupid is south of here.
Valhalla goes back to the west.
If you want to know what is up from here, you shall have to go up and see...

Room.Name: On the Rainbow Bridge
Room.Description: You have reached the center of the Rainbow Bridge. Clouds and mist swirl around your feet. The view from here is incredible. It is little wonder that the heavens were saved for the gods personal pleasures.

Exit.Description: The Rainbow Bridge continues upwards into the heavens.
The Rainbow Bridge disappears down into the clouds.

ExtraDescription.Description: The clouds are beautiful. There are shades of gray, pink and purple swirled into the blue sky.

Room.Name: The End of the Rainbow Bridge
Room.Description: You have reached the end of the Rainbow Bridge. Asgard stretches out above you. Looking around, you search for the legendary guardian of Asgard. The clouds are far below you and a sense of beauty and peacefulness surrounds you.

Exit.Description: Asgard is above you, spread out in all its glory.
Bifrost, the Rainbow Bridge leads down to the Temple of Midgaard.

Room.Name: Nature's Haven
Room.Description: Walking into this room it is as if you have steped through a protal to the outdoors. You can see no roof to the room and no edges to it's expansive boundries. A huge Oak Tree stands in the center of your view, looking as old as time itself. Bushes and a small stream seem to gravitate towards the tree as it sways with the light breeze bringing scents of daisies and roses to your nostrils.

Room.Name: Detlef's Pot House
Room.Description: You see leaves of the plant to the left and right of you. As before, the air is filled with a sweet fragrance which relaxes you and enhances your senses. You feel yourself becoming stuck in the hairs of the plant. If only real life could be this perfect.

NPC.name: Huge Oak Tree
NPC.description: The Tree stands in the center of the glade making everything around it seem tiny. It's branches sway in the wind making beautifull masic with it's branches. It's age could not be counted if you had all the time in the world for this tree is as old as the world itself.
NPC.longDescription: A Massive Oak Tree stands in the center of the Glade
NPC.shortDescription: A massive Oak Tree stands in the center of the Glade
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectHidden Sanctuary Flying PassDoor Haste DarkVision Regeneration

NPC.name: guardian newbie lone man
NPC.longDescription: A Lone Guardian Of Newbies Stands Here With His Trophies
NPC.shortDescription: A Lone Guardian Of Newbies Stands Here With His Trophies

Item.Name: Bushes gateway portal
Item.ShortDescription: a few bushes are bunched together making a sort of gateway through the leaves
Item.LongDescription: A few bushes are bunched together making a sort of gateway through the leaves

Item.Name: Armrest Severed
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum NoDrop NoRemove RotDeath Flaming Frost Vorpal TwoHands Shocking Poison Unholy

Item.Name: flail breaker flesh
Item.ShortDescription: a flail made of elven flesh and skulls named, 'Will Breaker'
Item.LongDescription: A flail for a master drows hand sprawls across the floor here.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum Dark Magic RotDeath SellExtract

Item.Name: sword blade
Item.LongDescription: A wicked, serrated blade has been left here.
Item.ExtraFlags: Glow Hum Evil RotDeath SellExtract Flaming Frost Sharp Vorpal TwoHands Shocking Poison Unholy

Item.Name: guide
Item.ShortDescription: the quick guide to a hero's domination
Item.LongDescription: A book with all the answers calls out to you here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A bound book hums with untold wisdom..perhaps looking through these pages will get you on your way in these terrible lands. Looking at PageOne seems a good idea.

Welcome to the secret book of total POS domination. Count yourself lucky, people have killed for this information. Now read on and learn all you need to know. Getting Started: 1. Right when you create, your should first type Outfit. This will give you a basic set of armor to get started. Buying simple weapons, one south and up of the altar in Mid should be your next stop. At the merchant, type LIST to show his wares..then simply type BUY Dagger..etc..whichever weapon you wish, or purchase all of them if you want. Congrats, you now have armor and weapons. Next type PRAC ALL, to practice all your skills, spells, or sups to 75%. You are now ready to get on with the training. Look at pagetwo.

2. Training and getting the lay of the land. From market square in Midgaard, go one south, and three east to the sailor. It is here you can train your health points or mana, or other stats. Simply type TRAIN there to see how many training sessions you have and what you are able to spend them on. To Train them type Train hp..or train mana..etc to improve your stats. Once you are out of trains that is it..no more. If you have spare practices you can gain convert them. 10 pracs=one train here. Be careful of spending your practice sessions though, you might need them further down the road with cabal skills and the like. So you have armor and weapon and are trained. If you wish to spend your three hours as a protected newbie practicing your skills in a safe place, three west and three south, and one east of the market square in Midgaard would be the place to start. This is only able to be accessed by newbies, and the dummy does not hit that hard, so you will be able to practice parry, dodge..etc in relative safety. It's also a good place to learn what your skills *actually* do, if you have any questions on what a certain skill/spell/supplication does try looking to our helpfiles for an answer. For instance..typing HELP shield will bring up all related topics to shields..helpful for newbie paladins. Onward you go! Doing well so far right?

Item.Name: steel armguards
Item.LongDescription: A pair of steel armguards lie here.

Item.Name: steel gauntlets
Item.LongDescription: A pair of steel gauntlets lie here.

Item.Name: dusty necklace
Item.LongDescription: A necklace lies here, covered in dust.

Item.Name: ring
Item.ShortDescription: a ring set with a dull stone
Item.LongDescription: A dull newbie ring has been left here.

Item.Name: charred cloth bracer
Item.LongDescription: A cloth-bracer with charred edges lies here.

Item.Name: embrioedered leather belt
Item.LongDescription: An embroidered leather belt has been left here.

Item.Name: cloth leggings
Item.LongDescription: A pair of cloth leggings lie on the ground.

Item.Name: iron tarnished boots
Item.LongDescription: A pair of tarnished iron boots lie here, damaged.

Item.Name: head pole
Item.LongDescription: An unbalanced pole has been abandoned here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Two sunken eyes stare at you, lifelessly yet still eminating enough light to keep your surroundings visible.

Item.Name: steel shield polished
Item.LongDescription: A polished steel shield has been left here.

Item.Name: leather backpack pack
Item.LongDescription: A leather backpack lies on the ground.

Item.Name: parchment map plain
Item.LongDescription: A map on plain parchment lies here.

ExtraDescription.Description: To Practice: n,w,n,w To Train: s,3e,s Strange Mansion: 21e,8n,w,n Riven Rock Canyon: 12e,3n,w,2n,e,n,e,2n,e,2n Strange Carnival: s,2e,2s,8w,s,w,2e,7n Nightfall: 3e,4n,2w,7n,6e,4s,3e,d,s,d,2s,e,3s,e,2s,2e,2s,e,2s,2e,2s,3e,2s,u,2e,2n,e,n,e,4u,2e, 2d,e Nightfall Keep: 3e,4n,2w,7n,6e,4s,3e,d,s,d,2s,e,3s,e,2s,2e,2s,e,2s,2e,2s,3e,2s,u,2e,2n,e,n, 4u,2e,2d,10e,s,2e,3u,e,3d,2e,s Ramadhn: 6e,n,w,2n,3w,7n,3e,17n Dark Forest: 3e,4n,2w,13n The Valley Inn: 4e,3n,2w Lich Tower: n,d The Hobo Train Yard: 4e,3n,2w,5n,w,2n,2e Mausoleum: 40e,n,6e,2n,2e,n,e,d,2s Tar Valon: 6e,n,w,2n,3w The Lost Prison: 21e,12n Battlefield: 3e,4n,2w,4n,w,5n,2w Southern Swamps: 40e,n,6e, all south Castle of Giants: 6e,4s,2e,s,2e,d,5n,2w,6n Emerald Forest: 6s,w,s,2w,2s,e,s,w,2s,e,3s,w,s,w,u Varggin Shih: n,d,3w,3s,d,2s,d,n,u,w,u,n,u,2n,e,d,n,d,2n
